en: Be ddigwyddodd i Dadi 'fyd, Carwyn? Hmm?

en: Cos he couldn't handle it inside.
Blydi hel! 'Sa chdi 'di gallu rhoi fractured skull iddo fo!

en: Hen bryd i rywun cnocio bach o sens i mewn i'r pen steroids 'na.

en: 'Wan, dos a fo o 'ma cyn i mi sticio hwn yn rhywla arall.
vi: Get him out before I stick this somewhere else.

en: Ti isio i fi ffonio'r cops, Nefyl?
vi: Shall I phone the cops, for you Neville? We'll get you for this, bitch!

en: Gawn ni chdi am hyn, y bitch! Mark my words!
Oes gynnoch chi gameras yn y lle 'ma?
ond mi ddeletia i bob dim i chi, ylwch.

Thanks. Here's cash for the beer and something for you for your trouble.

en: 'Ma chi, pres i chi am y cwrw
a rhywbeth i chitha am eich trafferth.
-Reit, well i ni fynd cyn -Cyn i takeaways ni fynd yn oer, ia?

en: Naci, Leswold. Cyn i'r cafalri gyrraedd, 'de!

Are you going to eat it?

en: os ti'm isio fo, ia, gyma i o, isn't it?
vi: if you don't want it, I'll have it, okay?

en: 'Sdim isio i ti gymryd sylw o'r pen steroids yn y pyb 'na, iawn?
vi: Take no notice of what that twat in the pub said.

en: Naci, Gronw, chi sy 'di malu cachu wrtha fi.

vi: - Just fuck off! - I'll talk to him.

Ddaw at ei goed. Ga' i air efo fo peth cynta yn y bore.

en: Ddudis i dylen ni 'di deud y gwir wrtho fo o'r dechrau do.
vi: We should've told him the truth from the start.

en: Does 'na'm byd fedrwn ni neud 'wan, nagoes Antonia?

vi: Exactly. Alright, I'm off to bed.

en: Olreit, dw i am y ciando.

vi: See you lot in the morning.

en: Iawn - tyrd, Les. Mae'n amser i ni fynd yn ôl i'r Royal hefyd.
vi: C'mon, Les, let's head back to the Royal.

en: Gad o'r gannet. Jyst tyrd, wnei di?
vi: Leave it, gannet. Just move it.

en: Noswaith dda, gyfeillion, a wela i chi yn y bore.
vi: Goodnight and see you in the morning. Thanks for everything.

en: Diolch yn fawr iawn am bopeth.
Be ddigwyddodd i Dadi 'fyd, Carwyn? Hmm?
vi: What happened to Daddy, Carwyn? Hm?

en: Hongian ei hun yn jail nath o 'de, Carwyn bach?
vi: Hung himself in jail, didn't he, Carwyn?

en: Be ti'n neud yn y tywyllwch yn fan'ma ar dy ben dy hun bach?
vi: What are you doing here on your own in the dark?

en: Ffwc o ffor' i ffeindio allan.
vi: Fuck of a way to find out.

en: Roeddan ni'n mynd i ddeutha chdi, 'sti.

en: Pryd yn union oedd hynna i fod i ddigwydd, ta?

Gafodd dy dad jail o dair mlynedd
vi: Your father was jailed for three years

en: am y ddamwain craen ar y site adeiladu yn Llundain
vi: for the crane accident on a building site in London

en: Ond, o'n i'n meddwl mai Dad gafodd ei ladd ar y bulding site.
vi: I thought Dad was killed in the building site.

en: Mi gadwodd dy fam hynna i gyd oddi wrtha chdi
vi: Your mother kept the truth from you to protect you.

en: 'Sgin i'm byd ar ôl i golli rwan, nagoes?
vi: I've got nothing left to lose now, do I?
Huston's and Co promised to protect your father whilst he was inside

a gwarchod chdi a dy fam yn ariannol fel rhan o'r fargen.

en: Fall guy i'r cwmni oedd dy dad.

en: Doedd yna'm bai arno fo o gwbl.

en: Cymryd y rap am be ddigwyddodd nath o
vi: He took the rap for what happened to save Huston's and protect you.

en: er mwyn achub busnes Huston a'ch gwarchod chi.
Mi ddiflannodd firm Huston's i Alicante, medda Gronw.

en: cynta medran nhw, efo pres y firm i gyd

vi: With the firm's money, and left your dad.
He must've realised Huston's had screwed you all, and it...

en: bod Huston's wedi'ch sgriwio chi i gyd a wedyn

vi: well... it pushed him over the edge.

en: fod hynna 'di bod yn ormod iddo fo.
'Sdim rhyfedd iddi gael breakdown felly, nagoes?
vi: No wonder she had a breakdown.

en: Dyna pam 'dan ni'n gneud y job 'ma de.
vi: That's why we're doing this job.

en: Er mwyn gneud yn siŵr bod ni'n talu nôl
vi: To pay them back for what they did to your dad,

heb son am be nathon nhw i Yncl Telor.

vi: So the rocks will be with you on Monday, Ishmael.

vi: I'll drop them off, you check them,

vi: and Jiffy will pick up the cash later on.

en: Seven replicas for you, dear boy.
vi: Seven replicas for you, dear boy.

en: Cut exactly to the dimensions of the lightning you showed me.
vi: Cut exactly to the dimensions of the lightning you showed me.

vi: Well, well, if you pay us in 50s

vi: on the price that we agreed, around 80K a rock,

vi: that bag should hold half a million easily.

Go in peace and return in peace.

en: Bore da, Carmella dlws. Bellissima moglie.
Carbo de - mae ei wely o'n wag, ei fag o 'di mynd
vi: Carbo. His bed's empty, his bag's gone and this was by the bed.

en: ac mae o 'di gadael hwn ar ochr ei wely.
Falla bod o 'di picio allan i glirio'i ben mae o. Ddaw o nôl toc.

en: 'Stedda lawr, cym banad. Falla bod o 'di mynd i weld yr hogia yn y Royal.

en: Neu 'di cael llond bol a 'di gadael.
vi: Or he's had enough and left.

en: Nath Aldo siarad efo fo neithiwr. Deud y gwir am bob dim.

He isn't here. He's done another flit.

en: Mae o 'di neud fflit arall ma'n rhaid do.
Ia. Ia, iawn. Iawn, over and out.

en: Fedran ni no way neud y job hebddo fo.
Sori, o'n i'n meddwl mai rhywun arall oeddach chi.

en: Iawn, deuda i wrtho fo. Ylwch, ma'n rhaid i fi fynd, Gwilym.

 Alright?

en: Helpwch eich hunan, hogia. Mae 'na de yn y tebot.

en: Wel, ddeuda i wrthach chi hyn am ddim, 'de

Un fel'na fuodd Carwyn Robaitsh erioed.

en: Dw i'n mynd allan am awyr iach

Bydd yn rhaid i ni adael i Cidw wbod am hyn fydd.

Good point.
 And he's quite an odd fella, isn't he?

en: Dyna'r cwbl sy gynna i i ddeud 'tha chi am rwan.

vi: Oh, and send my love to Mam.

en: Guessiwch pwy dw i newydd ffeindio!

ac yn sychu ei dronsha ar damaid o linyn myn dian i.

en: Ti dal yn stunning hyd yn oed pan wyt ti 'di gwylltio.
vi: You're still stunning even when you're angry.

en: Dw i'n mynd i gofio Dad fel o'dd o.
vi: I'm going to remember Dad as he was.

en: Pan oeddan ni i gyd yn hapus
vi: When we were all happy... in here.

en: Heads up, both. Ma'r three degrees ar y ffor'.
vi: Head's up, both. The Three Degrees are coming.

en: 'Sgin i'm Scooby-Doo pwy 'dy fy nhad i, 'sti, Carbo.
vi: I don't have a Scooby-Doo who my father is.

en: Nathon nhw jyst dympio fi ar Meri Jên.
vi: I was just dumped on Meri Jen.

en: -Lle ddiawl ti 'di bod? -Yn fan'ma de. Gweithio.

en: Ti isio siarad efo fi am y peth?
dw i'n edifar o waelod calon

 OK. See you back at the house.

en: Coed i chdi i gadw'r fire 'ma i fynd.

en: Dach chi 'di dod yn agos dros y dyddiau diwetha 'ma neu rywbeth?
vi: Become besties over the last few days?

vi: Very quiet today, sunshine. It's not like you at all.

en: Mae o'n disgwyl i chdi alw.
No probs. Consider it done, sunshine.

vi: Why does everyone keep asking if I'm OK?

vi: He'd be very proud of you.

en: Paid tyllu gormod i mewn i dy ben, chwilio am atebion sydd ddim yna.
vi: Don't play stuff out in your head. Sometimes, there are no answers.

en: Mi neith dy goconut di mewn.
Dim os wela i di gynta, y Teletubby.

en: Nos da ta, Carwyn Robaitsh. Wela i di ben bore.

en: Dw inna'n prowd iawn ohonoch chdi hefyd.

en: Yndi, mae o fan hyn i chi.
Jyst about, 'de. Mae 'di bod yn hectig arnom ni, on'd ydy?

It's been hectic.
 Tell me about it.

en: Ydy'r criw yn barod gen ti, 'ta?
Ydyn. Pawb yn barod pen yma, beth bynnag.

en: Wel, croesi popeth eith bod dim yn iawn felly, ia?

en: Ia, pan fydd hyn i gyd drosodd

All good, Jiff?
 All systems go, Cidw.

Bloomin' marvellous, blow the candle out

vi: Stand by, troops. Over and out.

en: Dw i'n mynd i fethu chdi'n ofnadwy, 'sti, boi.

en: Ma'n rhwygo fi'n ddarnau, 'sti, Mic. Gweld o'n mynd o fan hyn.
vi: It breaks my heart he's leaving.

en: Ma'r hen le 'ma yn mynd i fod yn unig hebddo fo.
vi: It'll be lonely here without him.

en: 'Dan ni i gyd yn unig weithiau lle bynnag 'dan ni.
vi: We're all lonely sometimes, wherever we are.

en: Fel wyt ti a fi weithiau.

vi: There's no point for the stallion to be lonely all the time.

en: Snap a branch! Gaddo lwmp o storm yn ôl hwn, Gandalf.

Ignore it. I can't remember it ever being right.

Chwaer i'r haul ei hun, self winder 'dy o.

en: Chollith hon ddim eiliad i ti
vi: It won't lose a second, seeing as you're never still.

en: Cymra hi gen i, presant pen-blwydd i ti.
vi: Take it as a birthday present.

en: Fyddi di ei hangen hi i gadw eiliadau ar y job byddi.
vi: You'll need it to count the seconds.

Shut it for once, Carwyn Roberts!
Take it from one who knows.

en: Dy dad o'dd pia hi, ti'n gweld.

en: I don't believe it. Ma' gen i 28 o voicemails!
vi:
I don't believe it.
 I've got 28 voicemails.

en: And I bet ma' gen Mother ma' every single one.
vi: And I bet every single one's from Mother.
-Oh, no. This is her now. -Answer it, then.

en: Well i chi ei ateb o, felly, yndy.
Dyro fo ar speaker i ni gael laugh.
vi: Put it on speaker for a laugh.
- Can you hear me? - Loud and clear like a bell.

en: Loud and clear fel cloch, Mother.
Dw i 'di trio bod yn trio cael gafaels arnach chdi ers dyddia.
vi: I've tried to get hold of you for days.

en: Wedais i wrthoch chi bod dim reception i fyny fan'ma.

en: Lle uffar wyt ti? Out in the wilds of Borneo?
vi: Out in the wilds of Borneo?

en: dydy dy dear old mother ddim yn cysgu blincsan pryd ti ddim adra.

en: A ti ddim yma i neud y weekly shop yn Lidls.

Taxi? Do you know much they charge just to go around the corner, nowadays?

en: Ti'n gwbod faint maen nhw'n charjo i fynd rownd cornel nowadays?

vi: Go to bingo, then. They serve food there.

en: Maen nhw'n neud bwyd yn fan'na, dydyn? Ffycin hel!

Oh!
 Leswold Clarence Moore. Don't you dare swear at your mother.

en: paid ti meiddio rhegi fel'na ar dy fam.
Ac os wyt ti'n meddwl dod adre in your own time
vi: If you think you can come home in your own time,

vi: And maybe Bentley and Shandy will be eating me

en: from my slippers up, isn't it?
vi: from my slippers up, isn't it?

en: Hoist the Jolly Roger, Mr Finnley.
vi: Hoist the Jolly Roger, Mr Finnley.

vi: Pleasure to see you both again.

vi: I'll be with you in a sec.

en: Ma'n amser i fi fynd i fyny.

on Celtic Pride today.

vi: Force eight, maybe nine, but we'll keep you updated, of course.

en: It puts me right off my custard tarts.
vi: All this jigging up and down puts me right off my custard tarts.

vi: I'll pour you a strong one and let you in as soon as I can.

en: The service here will come to those who wait, Madam, so excuse me.
vi: Service will come to those who wait, madam, so excuse me.

en: All yours then, Tyffdi. Have to chop your hand to get that off.
vi:
All yours then, Tufty.
 Right.
 They'll have to chop your hand to get that off.

en: Hiya. Did you get my email?
vi: Hiya. Did you get my email?

en: Weli di Mici Ffin yn rhywle 'ma?
vi: Can you see Mici Finn anywhere?
Yeah, of course. Oh, that's brilliant. Thank you so much.

en: Oh, that's brilliant. Thank you so much.
Ma' Daf wedi mynd a Tyffdi i'r lolfa ers chwarter awr dda.
vi: Right, Daf took Tufty to the lounge 15 minutes ago.

en: Felly, dylai fe fod yn sparked right out erbyn hyn.
vi: He should be sparked out by now.

en: Be am Mici? Lle ffyc ma' hwnnw?
vi: What about Mici? Where the fuck is he?

en: Jyst dilyn y chalk marks, Michael.
vi: Just follow the chalk marks, Michael.
Shite. Now what do we do?

en: Plîs deutha i bo chdi 'di bod yn gweld Trefor
vi: Please say you saw Trefor in Gwenlli Stores this morning?

en: Don't panic, the man's a mechanic.
vi: Don't panic, the man's a mechanic.

en: Not all heroes wear capes, Carbo.
vi: Not all heroes wear capes, Carbo.

en: Chwech munud a hanner i fynd.
vi: Six and a half minutes to go.

en: Cofia be o'n i'n deutha chdi yn Bwlch y Gloch. Nice and easy.
vi: Remember what I said in Bwlch y Gloch, nice and easy.

en: You're not going to cash in that chip already, are you?
vi: You're not going to cash in that chip already, are you?

en: Oh, he's spent all the pocket money Mummy gave him.
vi: Oh, he spent all the pocket money Mummy gave him.

en: Think you're a proper wise guy, don't you?
vi: Think you're a proper wise guy, don't you?

en: Do I know you from somwhere?
vi: Do I know you from somewhere?

en: Oh, we must have done. When was it now?
vi: Oh, we must have done. When was it now?

en: You know, was it Kentucky Fried Chicken maybe?
vi: You know, was it Kentucky Fried Chicken maybe?

en: Watch your lip, pal, just in case I split it open for you.
vi: Watch your lip, pal, just in case I split it open for you.

en: Estynna gliw i lenwi'r twll te, Les.
vi: Pass the glue so I can fill the hole.

en: Mae 'na wyth carreg yn fan hyn, Les
vi: There are eight stones here, Les.

en: a dim ond saith sy gen i yn hon i swopio nhw.
vi: I've only got seven to swap.

en: a rhoi un o'r rai go iawn yn ôl i mewn efo nhw mewn i'r velvet bag.
vi: And put one of the real ones back in the velvet bag.

en: Tri munud a hanner i fynd, sunshine.
vi: Three and a half minutes to go.

en: Os deffrith hwnna rwan, Les, cnocia fo allan, iawn?
vi: If he wakes up, knock him out, OK?

en: Might as well join Tyffdi and get my head down for an hour or two.
vi: Might as well join Tufty and get my head down for an hour or two.

en: I owe you a drink, don't I?
vi: I owe you a drink, don't I?

en: since Lady Luck isn't with you today.
vi: Since... since Lady Luck isn't with you today.

en: -Whisky on the rocks please, barman. -No problem, madam.
vi: -Whisky on the rocks, please, barman. -No problem, madam.

en: I'll fetch some more ice for you.
vi: I'll fetch some more ice for you.

en: I always recognise a man of high calibre.
vi: I always recognise a man of high calibre.
- Where the hell is he going? -Don't know. Just stick to the plan.

en: Dw i'm yn gwbod. 'Dy o'm ots, stick to the plan.
I don't know who you think you are but if you think
vi: I don't know who you think you are,

en: I'm Kentucky Fried Chicken, you've got another thing coming.
vi: but if you think I'm Kentucky Fried Chicken,
you've got another thing coming, you Welsh prick.

en: Now listen hear, shit-head, you tell your old man
that we Welsh pricks will never forget
vi: You tell your old man that we Welsh pricks will never forget

en: what he did to our own people.
vi: what you did to our own people.

en: Mic, dw i methu a chael gafael ar Dad.
vi: Mick, I can't get hold of Dad.

en: Dw i 'di trio ffonio fo naw o weithiau yn barod.
vi: I've tried phoning nine times now.

en: Ti 'di trio fo ar ei fobile? Ella bod o yn y Goat.
vi: -Try his mobile. He might be in the Goat. -I have.

en: Dw i'n cael bad vibes am hyn a ti'n 'nabod fi am bad vibes.
vi: I'm getting bad vibes about this.
-And you know me and bad vibes. -Ya-fucking-hoo!

en: Be sy? O'n i'n meddwl bo ni'n mynd yn syth i werthu Chief?
vi: What's wrong? Shouldn't we go to sell Chief?

en: Poeni am Gronw mae hi. 'Dy hi methu cael gafael arno fo yn nunlle.
vi:
She's worried about Gronw.
 She can't get hold of him.

en: Mae 'na rywbeth 'di digwydd iddo fo. Dw i'n gwbod.
Ma'n rhaid i fi ffarwelio efo Chief a dal y llong nesa nôl am adre.
vi: I'll say goodbye to Chief and catch the next boat home.

en: Af fi a'r cerrig i Ishmael os ti ishe.
vi: I'll take the stones to Ishmael.

en: Wela i di nôl yn y fflat nes ymlaen i sblitio cash y criw.
vi: See you back at the flat to split the crew's cash.

en: Dw i'm 'di cael fy mhen i lawr ers dyddia. Wela i di wedyn.
vi: I haven't had my head down in days. See you later.

en: -A diolch i ti am bob dim. -Na, i ti ma'r diolch, Ald.
Ti 'di aberthu llawer mwy na'r rest ohonom ni
vi: You sacrificed more than the rest of us.

en: a ti'n haeddu pob ceiniog o'r arian 'ma am dy waith caled.
vi: You worked hard and deserve every penny.

en: Be sy 'di digwydd? Dy o'm di?
Na, cael pwl arall o angina nath o bore 'ma.
vi: He had another angina attack this morning.

en: Lwc mod i yma peth cynta, ynde?
vi: Lucky I was here first thing. I gave him his tablets.

en: Wnes i roi ei dabledi iddo fo.

vi: Dad! Oh, Dad, are you OK?
I'm fine. I just had a bad attack.

en: Dw i wedi cael rhyw hen bwl drwg, ysti.
-Wel, nathoch chi ddal y mellt? -Do, giaffar.
vi: Well, did you catch the lightning?

en: -Chi 'dy'r deimond go iawn, siŵr. -Mi gaethoch chi nhw felly.
vi:
Yes, gaffer.
 -You're the real diamond.
 So you got them, then?

en: Wel, diolch i chi, yr hen blant.
Dw i'n falch tu hwnt i eiriau.
vi: I'm proud of you beyond words.

en: Ma'r dial drosodd i mi bellach.
Twll dy din di, Jack Huston!
Ac mi gewch chi'ch dau bach eich siâr o'r cregyn 'wan, yn cewch
vi: Take your share of the shells

en: er mwyn i chi gael mynd i glywed sŵn y môr efo'ch gilydd.
vi: to the seaside to listen to the sound of the sea.

en: Do we have cause for concern?
vi: Do we have cause for concern?

en: Give me a few hours to get the bread ready for you.
vi: Give me a few hours to get the bread ready for you.

en: Jiffy will pick it up this afternoon at three o'clock, on the dot.
vi: Jiffy will pick it up this afternoon at three o'clock, on the dot.

en: And that bag will have half a million in it by then.
vi: And that bag will have half a million in it by then.
Coming home present, isn't it, eh?
